body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.21-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70878 **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new account, verify the account 2. Navigate to Wallet, click Enable Wallet 3. Press "Add bank account" green button, continue with the Regions bank 4. When back in ND, on "Choose your bank account" RHP select "Plaid Saving", click Next 5. Enter the name, click Next 6. Select Date of birth, Next 7. Click back arrow until you reached step 1 8. On "Choose your bank account" RHP click Next 9. On "Confirm your bank account" RHP click Confirm ## Expected Result: User is able to proceed with the flow, "What's your legal name" RHP opens ## Actual Result: User is not able to proceed, error "Bank account can't be created, it looks like a bank account with the same information already exists in your account." is displayed. After refreshing the page User is finally moved to the next step ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Account > Wallet. 3. Click on the virtual card. 4. Click Reveal details. 5. Close the RHP. 6. title: [$250] Expense - Expense is auto approved despite the "Rules" feature being disabled.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.21-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1104/41236889/927169479?q=rules&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1874@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace available. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" and open any workspace. 3. Tap on "More Features" and enable "Rules": 4. Upgrade the workspace plan if necessary. 5. Navigate to "Rules" and enable "Auto-approve compliant reports" 6. Note that a "Auto-approve reports under" rule, appears. 7. Navigate to workspace chat and create a manual expense with an amount that fits the rule in step 6. 8. Tap on "Submit" on the expense preview. 9. Open the expense report. 10. Note that expense was "Approved via workspace rules" 11. Unapprove and delete the expense. 12. Navigate to "Workspaces" > "More Features" again. 13. Disable the "Rules" feature. 14. Navigate to "Overview" > "Plan Type" 15. Downgrade the workspace level to "Collect" again, 16. Return to workspace chat. 17. Create a new manual expense with an amount that fits the now disabled rule. 18. Tap on "Submit" on expense preview. 19. Open the expense report. 20. Note that expense was still "Approved via workspace rules" ## Expected Result: Expenses shouldnÂ´t be auto approved after the "Rules" feature is disabled and the workspace plan type downgraded. ## Actual Result: Expenses are auto approved via workspace rules, despite the "Rules" feature being disabled and workspace plan type being downgraded to "Collect". ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c8e0c47-139f-4b8f-ba0f-004448b7816b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$25] Add context comment to help with auto-translating "Outstanding" report status

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem

In New Expensify, submitted reports have the status `Outstanding`. This word has multiple meanings in English, and our AI auto-translation into other languages doesn't always translate based on the correct definition. Examples:

- Portuguese: `Excelente` (incorrect)
- French: `Exceptionnel` (incorrect)
- Spanish: `Pendiente` (correct)

## Solution

We can add a context annotation in the /App/blob/main/src/languages/en.ts file. The annotation should say:

```
// @context meaning "remaining to be paid, done, or dealt with", not "exceptionally good"
outstanding: 'Outstanding',
```

Then, retranslate that either with:

`npx ts-node ./scripts/generateTranslations.ts --paths 'common.outstanding'`

or commit the change and open a PR, or you can run it locally with:

`npx ts-node ./scripts/generateTranslations.ts --compare-ref main`

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @pecanoro</details>
